Design a monster.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Suggestions for Tecmo: Design a monster.
By Harle on Wednesday, February 27, 2002 - 06:59 pm:

Wouldn't that be a nice feature? I read someone's post about having a Zuum/Dragonwings/Gali mask. And I just though, "Why not design a monster all together?" Granted it would take a lot of memory, and alot of money, but I'd be willing to pay the extra money to watch a tie-dyed dragon with butterfly wings, duke it out with a striped banana mocchi.
You know, different combinations=different moves/stats, much like the randomity of the code reading of the discs.
Hey, if they can put your picture in the game, why not let you design the monster you're going to train? Heck, why not let us design a likeness of ourselves as the trainer, so it seems like we're actually doing something instead of an assistant taking up the payroll..
I'm a greedy person ^^;;

By DigMoshMogi on Thursday, February 28, 2002 - 09:25 am:

By Tigerbubble on Thursday, February 28, 2002 - 11:07 am:

I love your idea, but i'm worried that it might take the fun out of finding monsters on saucer stones if you could simply make your own. Maybe they could make it so that you could unlock certain features from saucer stones, like the butterfly wings or different kinds of butterfly wings, etc...

By Khift on Sunday, March 24, 2002 - 04:40 pm:

Yeah, that would be interesting. Have every CD give you a monster with 3 'pieces' and a paint job on it. Then, after you've completely sorted through your CD library, you can take groups of monsters sorted by main type and switch the 'pieces' and paint jobs between them. Have a system that only allows you one piece per area (Nobody can have 3 sets of wings or 4 tails coming out of their behinds etc). That would make an interesting creation system. Maybe for a large sum you can purchase a new pieces for your monsters.

Plenty of ideas for this thread.

By Lightning Tiger on Monday, March 25, 2002 - 04:41 pm:

Well, I don't know how you can make an addition to a game, but they could have different sets of the games. The ones that don't have as many features cost less, but the ones that have more cost more. Also if you buy a cheaper one and then save, then if you brought a more expensive game, you could transfer the data from lesser games so you wouldn't have to start all over.

Hmmmm, maybe we could make Zans with dragon wings or something..... Or tigers with wings, too. We could also have.....uh.....
